intro: Alsomitra rotundifoliola, commonly known as the round-leaf alsomitra, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
